definition: to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
surname Xue
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
frost/white powder or cream spread over a surface/frosting/(skin) cream

sentences.english: Climate change and extreme weather events will further complicate the picture.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化和极端天气现象更使情况雪上加霜。

sentences.english: Nothing will contribute more to that than an extended re-litigation of the last eight years.
sentences.chinese: 过去8年，年复一年的漫长纷争只会使之雪上加霜。

sentences.english: Our current bathtubs are even worse. Kira said
sentences.chinese: 我们目前的浴缸更是雪上加霜。

sentences.english: Demolishing the Fengtai settlement only adds insult to injury.
sentences.chinese: 拆迁丰台区的这个村落只会雪上加霜。

sentences.english: I'm still going to be tortured and now we've added insult to injury.
sentences.chinese: 我还是要被折磨，现在还雪上加霜。

sentences.english: Some of the outdated ideas of the people make environmental destruction even worse.
sentences.chinese: 人们的一些陈旧观念使我国环境破坏雪上加霜。

sentences.english: To add insult to injury, the storm did not just hit Pinar del Rio's tobacco crop.
sentences.chinese: 雪上加霜的是，飓风不仅仅袭击了西方省的烟草作物。

sentences.english: The impersonator to rely on financial aid for Greece worse.
sentences.chinese: 这些冒领让依赖救援的希腊财政雪上加霜。

sentences.english: Further work by Seiffert's team appears to add insult to injury.
sentences.chinese: 塞弗特团队的进一步研究更是雪上加霜。

definition: when it rains, it pours (idiom)
pinyin: wu1 lou4 pian1 feng2 lian2 ye4 yu3

definition: misfortune does not come singly (idiom)/it never rains but it pours
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to suffer unspeakable misery/indescribably painful/hellish
to worsen
lit. build a high desk of debt (idiom); heavily in debt
to steadily deteriorate
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
awkward situation/predicament
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
in short supply/dire/tense/critical/hard-pressed/important
imminent danger (idiom); approaching a crisis
to hit hard
grave/serious/severe/critical
